title: Only getting 'reason=timeout' for 'Stopping work on payload' notifications
body:
Running GETH 1.11.6 and Prysm 4.0.3 via the Rocketpool SmartNode. No validator running (yet)

Everything else in the logs look healthy. Good amount of synced peers both for the EC and CC. 

Is it intended behaviour ? I'm litterally never getting _'reason=delivery'_ for those _'Stopping work on payload'_ notifications.

Logs excerpt :

> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:01.527] Starting work on payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:01.594] Updated payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 number=17,094,938 hash=c06e4b..246230 txs=40  gas=2,695,737  fees=0.01341559371   root=1df4af..b78d67 elapsed=65.181ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:03.638] Updated payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 number=17,094,938 hash=9291e2..73b650 txs=55  gas=4,105,173  fees=0.01701709468   root=8b6f7a..728227 elapsed=43.630ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:05.685] Updated payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 number=17,094,938 hash=d06a7c..40eca2 txs=70  gas=5,319,861  fees=0.01930305102   root=98994c..596a64 elapsed=45.243ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:07.733] Updated payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 number=17,094,938 hash=31badc..44e18d txs=94  gas=7,288,594  fees=0.0229569909    root=59d301..c31022 elapsed=48.311ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:09.766] Updated payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 number=17,094,938 hash=637542..4237eb txs=112 gas=9,020,375  fees=0.02480740483   root=4f2aff..dc87eb elapsed=32.563ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:11.809] Updated payload id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 number=17,094,938 hash=0131d9..7ddda0 txs=142 gas=11,244,577 fees=0.02693994256   root=f92593..8f90f6 elapsed=41.651ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:12.936] Imported new potential chain segment     number=17,094,938 hash=4a96b4..d1db45 blocks=1 txs=143 mgas=11.467 elapsed=51.034ms   mgasps=224.688 dirty=255.49MiB
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:12.976] Chain head was updated                   number=17,094,938 hash=4a96b4..d1db45 root=f834bc..84b716 elapsed=1.860083ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:13.043] Starting work on payload                 id=0x3390763b8e54c7ed
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:13.063] Updated payload                          id=0x3390763b8e54c7ed number=17,094,939 hash=816520..1bc7dd txs=52  gas=5,317,018  fees=0.01265509503   root=25e4d5..6c246e elapsed=19.958ms
> rocketpool_eth1  | INFO [04-21|13:03:13.529] Stopping work on payload                 id=0x6f60f1f085f38704 reason=timeout
> 

Thanks alot.

> Rocketpool SmartNode

I have no idea what that does. It seems that it asks your geth-node to build a block, but it doesn't bother to collect the work performed. I do not know if that is intended behaviour or not, but it's not an issue with geth. I'd open an issue with them instead.

Have almost the same issue. Running geth 1.11.6 and prysm 4.0.3. With active validators. 
"Stopping work on payload reason=timeout" message appears only when it's trying to propose block. 
This error appeared after Shapella upgrade, it was ok before. So all my blocks since Shapella are missed or orphaned. 

Geth output

> INFO [04-29|08:13:47.742] Starting work on payload                 id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd
> INFO [04-29|08:13:47.791] Updated payload                          id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd number=17,149,012 hash=5cabb2..8800eb txs=12  gas=22,602,833 fees=0.003240511441 root=61b98a..a57399 elapsed=48.073ms

> INFO [04-29|08:13:52.105] Updated payload                          id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd number=17,149,012 hash=b87374..8c8529 txs=53  gas=26,307,824 fees=0.01237431773  root=ea8622..155ca3 elapsed=104.134ms
> INFO [04-29|08:13:54.164] Updated payload                          id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd number=17,149,012 hash=0252b8..4152fb txs=60  gas=26,616,445 fees=0.0125114773   root=5a691a..1c4414 elapsed=55.561ms
> INFO [04-29|08:13:56.222] Updated payload                          id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd number=17,149,012 hash=1d9c59..6fec38 txs=78  gas=28,174,903 fees=0.02149302733  root=751225..194f92 elapsed=44.934ms
> INFO [04-29|08:13:58.268] Updated payload                          id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd number=17,149,012 hash=2ec167..7b5696 txs=93  gas=29,209,751 fees=0.02233243972  root=503ab1..ca1036 elapsed=44.484ms
> INFO [04-29|08:13:59.743] Stopping work on payload                 id=0x4513bffcbfa543cd reason=timeout

Prysm beacon chain output

> [2023-04-29 08:14:08]  INFO rpc/validator: Received header with bid blockHash=0x577c89846a085b50a422abdd5183cf33ef585315242521ce20332cb560b3ed6a builderPubKey=0x9000009807ed12c1f08bf4e81c6da3ba8e3fc3d953898ce0102433094e5f22f21102ec057841fcb81978ed1ea0fa8246 value=84509687554387447

Prysm validator output

> [2023-04-29 08:14:11] ERROR validator: Failed to propose block blockSlot=6326168 error=rpc error: code = DeadlineExceeded desc = context deadline exceeded pubKey=0x9888075b6faa

Mev-boost output

Might be a Prysm issue then. I was running those exact same clients.
Out of curiosity, what's your network like ? Good speed and latency ? Fiber ?
@holiman Are you sure this is not geth error?

Having the same issue as well, missed block proposal because of this.
It might be a performance issue, it sounds like GETH is trying to build the block but can't finish within the slot duration and then it says "timeout".
I encountered the same problem when using the same version of geth and prysm to build a development network. It stopped working after producing 3168 blocks normally.
